abstract: Tech21 has created a line of phone cases line with D30, super-shock-absorbent material of a type called non-Newtonian polymer that inspires a lot of don't-try-this-at-home stunts, like getting whacked in the head with a shovel through a layer of the stuff.

snippet: Square's tie-up with  Starbucks  may be this year's most important venture capital deal.The deal not only has the potential to change the way people pay for coffee and everything else, it also shows how small innovation applied to everyday tasks m...
abstract: Steven M Davidoff Deal Professor column on Square's partnership with Starbucks for accepting mobile payments; says that while deal may be be revolutionary and a game changer, it is only the latest example of how Silicon Valley has become about process and networking more than anything else. abstract: Google is buying the Frommer's brand of travel guides from John Wiley & Sons for $23 million to expand its local and travel search results. Photo (M)1

headline.main: Google Says It Will Buy Frommer's For Content

snippet: He could be mistaken for a Wall Street banker. Or perhaps a hedge fund manager. Or even a managing director at a  private equity  firm, like Bain Capital. Paul Ryan , with his clean-cut Brooks Brothers looks and wonky obsession with spreadsheets, ...
abstract: Andrew Ross Sorkin Dealbook column notes presumptive Republican vice-presidential nominee Paul Ryan, who voted for the Glass-Steagall repeal in 1999, today says banks should not be too big to fail; points out he differs with Wall Street on some other points as well; holds while financiers may cheer for Ryan's pro-market policies, they may want to reassess just what those policies mean for their businesses. Photo (M)

headline.main: Everything Wall St. Should Know About Ryan
